text: Hypatima sublectella is a moth in the family Gelechiidae. It was described by Francis Walker in 1864. It is found on Borneo. Adults are dull ochraceous, the forewings with several black points, which are mostly on the costa. There are two irregular blackish bands, one near the base, the other exterior. The hindwings are cinereous.List of the Specimens of Lepidopterous Insects in the Collection of the British Museum 29: 640 ==References== Category:Hypatima Category:Moths described in 1864
title: Hypatima sublectella
